ratings.comment: She offers extra credit, which is really nice. Exams were pretty easy if you followed along in lecture, however, her slides are 50+ pages. Attendance for the discussion and lecture was mandatory, but the discussion really helped the class! She made us do an AI assignment that was not fun, so be prepared for that lol.
Amazing!! I learned a lot in every lecture, and they were always engaging. Exams were easy if you paid attention to lecture content, and she offers extra credit. Would recommend!

Really knowledgeable in the field, clearly explains course concepts. Grading is mostly through three in-class exams, 3 take-home exams, and a final paper. Lecture attendance is mandatory, but the lectures are interesting. Great class and would most definitely recommend to others.

I took honors psych and it was tough. Your grade is basically decided by the super-specific multiple-choice tests and this paper you spend the semester working on. You do all this weekly stuff that doesn't even really matter in the end. I did all the extra credit to finish with an AB. She's a decent prof just a bad setup for the class.

This is my favorite Psychology course I have taken at UW. Patti is very kind, knowledgeable, and funny. She presents material clearly and in a way that gets students ready for exams. Exams, papers, and assignments are all well-defined and doable given the instruction. I would easily take her again and I am glad that I was able to take her class.

Dr. Coffey is so knowledgable and clearly is well-respected in this field. The first section of the class is probs the most interesting and it sort of gets a bit more boring as the semester goes on. She assigns tons of readings but just read the books and then do the other readings as they're referenced in the take homes. Exams are easy.

Lectures are really informative and interesting. weekly quizzes are super easy, and the same questions from these quizzes appear on the exams. There are 3 exams, you read 3 books, and write one paper. The process of the paper is broken down so its simple. Overall, great and interesting class, I had a good experience even though it was all online.

Professor Coffey is great at communicating with the class throughout the semester. Her lectures are a little long and boring at times, but she always provides real-life applications to the concepts we learn. There is a lot of material, so you will need to carefully take notes and study, but the exams are manageable. I really enjoyed the class.

Professor Coffey is my favorite professor so far! She is a great lecturer and I got a lot out of the class. Her assignments were very fair and mainly just to make sure you keep up with the asynchronous class. Tests are open-note and plenty of chances for extra credit. She is very knowledgeable about psychology and I would definitely recommend her.

All the lectures were asynchronous and the tests have questions covered in her lectures. She gives a textbook for extra review but you don't need to read it to do well on the tests. All the tests had high averages so there was no curve. You do have to write 5 1 page papers but they are easy and boost your grade. She's the best Psych202 prof imo
She tends to go over the time limit on lectures but its all very interesting and she is really enthusiastic about this class.

The class was not quite as interesting as I had hoped, but Dr. Coffey is so passionate about the material and it shows. Lecture and discussion attendance are mandatory, but I largely feel that they were helpful and worth my time. Give assignments and paper drafts a real try, and don't wait to study for an exam until 2 days before.

She gives the opportunity for up to 15 points extra credit. I took psych 202 with her in fall 2019 and it was so so easy. I never went to class, all the lectures are recorded and online. Her tests are exclusively the examples from in class. I would recommend not going to class and watching the videos instead because she talks so fast!

Power lectures were tough but she tried to make the topics interesting by including videos that were related to the material. No textbook needed and all lectures were recorded and posted promptly. Extra credit was also offered that raised by one grade level. Patty tried her best to make the class fair. Tests were directly related to lectures.

Not a lot of homework. Must study for tests, pretty difficult. She goes through lectures so fast and it is hard to keep up-it gets very annoying, fast. I am always SOOO bored every lecture no matter how hard I try to focus. I feel like she means well, but she is very annoying about electronic use and talking. Very happy to be done with the class.

coffey is fine she does well enough given the course material. she rushes through every lecture and i feel like i spend the whole class playing catch-up. her TA was really sweet and graded every assignment on time.

One of the Best Psych 202 professors! She wants you to pass the class and give you all the tool necessary to do so. The class is very lecture heavy, but each one is posted and voice recorded. Tests are challenging, but all multiple choice and do able if you attend class and put in effort outside of class. Not a significant amount of homework either

I was really passionate about forensic psych before but Coffey really solidified that. She is knowledgeable about the topic and really goes out of her way to make students interested too. Lectures can sometimes get a bit dry, but overall they were really thought-provoking. She always answers questions and truly cares. Go to the prison simulation!

I always got a C or below on the tests, however I ended the class with an A because I attended all lectures, discussion, and did the huge extra credit assignment (worth about 25 points I believe). You do have to write a literature review with 10 sources, which was difficult but doable. Sort of boring lectures but the info was thought provoking

Absolutely amazing and life changing class. Would highly recommend. Tests are mostly straightforward and there is a giant extra credit assignment that is very helpful. One research paper, but not bad. Really changed my perspective on the criminal justice system. Easily one of the best classes Ive taken.

Easy class, she posts the lectures online so you can just watch them there. All I did was make flashcards for all of her lecture slides (4 exams, so you have some slack) and got an A. Extra credit raised my grade from an AB to an A, so make sure you do that. It's super easy quizzes that you take after class. Good professor, kind of boring but nice!

I hated psych going in to Freshman year. Somehow after taking this class, I somehow have a genuine interest in psychology. Exams are difficult, but there is extra credit that will make-up for it. She has a TON of stories bc of her extensive experience in the field, which always make lectures interesting. Recommend taking Psych 202 with her.

This class wasn't graded too harshly, the exams are straight forward and where you miss points you make them up in extra credit. Dr. Coffey is so knowledgable in the field and her insight to the course material from experience is so useful and interesting. Definitely wish I could go back and explore the criminal research field.

you'll find the class easy if you attend the lectures. If you miss one, she posts the slides and lecture recording online. 15 extra credit points possible by participating in studies. easy to listen to during lecture, 1-3 videos per lecture, if you review the material and use the quizzes as study guides you're golden for exams

Patti is such a good professor and is very good at explaining things in detail. I would recommend going to the lectures to take notes. She shares the powerpoints with you and she posts a voice recording of the lecture. She offers extra credit for doing psychology studies. Overall, this class is very good and informative, but study for the exam

Solid choice for a depth course. Interesting topics, lectures do sometimes drag on but they're not too bad considering their length. No textbook but lots of smaller readings either posted or from various books. Attendance is taken at lecture and discussion so beware of the grade hit if you tend to skip class often.

Really knew what she was talking about. Organize your notes well, but you won't need to do any reading outside of class. She gives 15 points of extra credit which will save you in the end since she doesn't curve exams. Really smart and nice prof!

Professor Coffey is enthusiastic about psychology, and that's clearly seen in her lecturing. While the lectures may seem kind of long and tedious at times, if you pay attention and take notes you should have no problem getting a good grade. There are 15 points of possible extra credit to earn as well.

Was a great professor. Tests are easy if you know how to study for them--Rewatch her lectures and review the notes she posts online and you'll be fine. She offers up to 15 points of extra credit - do it, it'll help. Homework was due every Tuesday but it should only take 15 minutes max if you attend lectures. Would highly recommend prof. coffey.

I was in the honors section and she was a really wonderful instructor. She's very patient and passionate about the topics, especially social psych. If you go to lectures and take good notes, the exams aren't too bad (they're all multiple choice). Because of this class, I've decided to take on psych as a major. I would highly recommend this class.

I love this woman so much! Her class is so easy and her lectures are interesting. If you just study her slides and quizzes for the test you can easily get a good grade. If that doesn't work, she lets you earn up to 15 points of extra credit. She is the easiest of all the psych professors so definitely take her class!

The lectures are posted online which are extremely helpful. You don't need to attend class to get a good grade in here. The professor says: "Uhhh", "umm", & "you know what I'm saying" so many times it was to the point that it was hard to concentrate, understand the point she was trying to convey, and cause the students to literally fall asleep.

She has recorded class online, so it is very easy to review stuff, and if you are fall asleep in class. Her test is almost based on ppt and things she talked about. Each lecture contains 1-3 interesting videos.
She is my favorite professor ever! Very knowledgeable, passionate, AND approachable! If you have any interest in psychology or exploring forensic psychology TAKE HER CLASS. She will inspire you.
She is great at lecturing and very approachable!
Very interesting  lectures. Very intelligent woman!

Patty is awesome. This class was so interesting. She mainly lectures via slides and posts them on D2L.  Attendance is taken now- apparently it wasn't in the past. She is very nice and accessible outside of class. Grading is clearly defined. Tests are challenging but fair. I hope I have her again.

Although I wasn't a big fan of power lectures, once I understood how to study for the class, I was able to find a way to skip them. Coffey records all of her lectures online. Her exams are lecture heavy, with focus on videos and examples from class. She is also extremely willing to help students outside of class. However, EC only raises you 1 grade

Coffey is an amazing professor and I'd recommend her to anyone looking for a psych class to change your way of thinking.  Lectures are course content are awesome and she really cares about her students and the course.
Her tests are pretty easy, but the lectures are kind of boring
Her exam review sessions are very helpful
Best psych professor, posts lecture slides online. Lectures are optional but helpful. Tests are really easy and there is a lot of extra credit.
Didn't do the readings and still passed. Easy class also interesting.

Patti is great, but you must go to lecture! It's easy to get an A if you do five things: 1) Go to lecture 2) Do the extra credit (all of it) 3) Read the book (it's a good read and funny) 4) Join a PLA session 5) Study the quizzes for the exam
Lectures are incredibly boring, but tests are fair and there is a lot of extra credit opportunities.

Hands down the most boring lecture I've ever been too, I went until the first midterm, and never went again.  That being said Prof. Coffey is obviously a very smart person, just not meant to be a teacher.  Slides are hard to understand and topics are kinda all over the place.

Patti was great! I was worried about this class, but she made it enjoyable and I actually liked the material! Lectures can be long, but her notes are put online and they are all you need to get the grade you want (Don't need the book) Also the extra credit helps a ton so do that! If you need psych take Patti!!

Psych isn't my thing, but this class was alright. As long as you go to lecture you'll do fine. Lectures do get boring occasionally, but she throws in videos now and then to keep you engaged. Do yourself a favor and avoid the power lecture if you can. Do not buy the book. I only opened it for the first exam and it was not worth it.

So easy.  Don't buy a textbook, because there are only 2 or 3 questions per test on it, and you can usually guess it correct.  Extra credit bumps you up to 5%, or one grade up (can't go from B to A, only B to AB).  Tests are 60 multiple choice.  GPA booster

This was honestly the best class that I have taken.  Professor Coffey has very clear criteria for how to get an A, and she offers extra credit to achieve one letter grade higher. The tests are based on lectures As long as you go to lecture and study, the tests are fairly straightforward.  I would definitely recommend Professor Coffey
She knows what she's doing. Psych 202? You are gonna have to put in some work to get a grade you want. Your grade and effort are directly proportional.

Patty is soooo passionate and knowledgable about criminal psychology.  3 tests: if you attend lecture and go over notes a few times, you will do great.  1 large research proposal paper due at the end of the term, but TAs offer a lot of help.  Definitely take this class.  2 assigned books, and a lot of assigned articles that you don't need to read.

From what I've heard about other Psych 202 professors Coffey is the best.  Her powerpoints can be a bit unorganized but she is a great professor and a fair test maker. I would definitely take her again.

Professor Coffey made learning Psychology so enjoyable this semester.  Although her power lectures could be long, she was good about adding quite a few videos to make it easier to pay attention.  Her tests are much more about knowing the material rather than memorizing, so I joined a PLA, and that helped tremendously.  Take Coffey's class!

TAKE THIS CLASS!!! Professor Coffey is an amazing lecturer and this class will completely change your viewpoint on major issues in our criminal justice system. She is amazing and confronts topics in an unbiased way. She really wants you to learn, not just memorize material.  Big research paper, take home tests, and in class tests.

Prof. Coffey is one of the kindest professors that I've had at UW. Powerpoints summarize EVERYTHING on the exam, except for 2 questions taken from the book. She stays after class to answer as many questions as students have, happily! The book questions are from the textboxes by the pictures throughout the book :) Take Patricia Coffey for Pysch 202!
No final test. No curve either though. Offers extra credit.
Coffey is great! You don't need to buy the book. You need to go to lecture, and she is very clear! I think 2/3 of the class got an A or AB. Her tests are not hard.

Patti's the bee's knees! One of the few professors with 300+ students in the class that's still able and willing to meet you one-on-one to discuss any issues. The course is evenly spread out exam-wise, but you need to go to lecture to do well. I found exam questions to be quite tricky. Hotness goes for teaching as well as looks.

Patti is an excellent professor. I learned a lot in psych 202 and find it applicable to everyday life. Coming to lecture and reading the textbook are important for getting a good grade. Loved this class!

Coffey is a good professor and knows her materials well. The lecture notes are posted online so you know what is going to be covered each week. Her tests are all multiple choice, there is no cumulative final, and you can get 15 extra credit points max. The test questions are application based rather than straight forward memorization questions.

Coffey is a great professor, her lectures and notes are well organized and very clear.  Tests are all multiple choice and are manageable if you read the questions carefully and study in advance.  Textbook readings aren't mandatory, but I highly recommend reading if you're aiming for a higher score.  Has great quiz and extra credit systems.

Coffey is very interesting and the lectures are the same, though long at times. Tests can be tough if you wait until the last night to start reviewing and studying the material, so id advise against that. There's no cumulative final which is awesome. As long you keep up with your studying, its a good class
Lectures are long and boring. She does not doing a good job teaching the material in class.  Not a lot of outside work. Just four exams throughout the semester.

Super nice professor who actually cares about her students, which is pretty cool seeing as there is about 300 people in her class. Clear lectures and always available for office hours. One of the best psych professors.

Patty was one of my favorite professors at UW-Madison.  She's very straightforward and genuinely wants you to succeed.  She is always willing to help and answer questions.  Her lectures were always really interesting and it was evident that she was really passionate about psych.  She also lets you drop a test grade! Take intro psych with patty!!

Patti is great! If you have to take psych 202, definitely take it with her! She lets you drop a midterm which is extremely helpful & is very willing to clarify material & help you learn study techniques. The class is difficult but work hard and join a PLA group - easily the best decision I made all semester - it really helps you understand the info

Patricia is the best of the Psych 202 options for a professor. The class is definitely tough, there's tons of reading, and lectures are pretty long and boring. Some of the material is interesting, but a lot of it is mind numbing.

If you've taken a psychology class before, this should be a breeze. I took Ed psych 320 my freshman year &had a general psychology class in high school. Half of the semester was like a review to me. Other students who've had no psych before struggled. Lectures are long &can get boring. She does offer 15 extra credit pts. &will drop a midterm exam.

If you've taken any psychology classes before, this class should be a breeze. I took Ed. Psych 321 my freshman year &had a general psychology class in highschool. Half of the semester was like a review to me. Other students who haven't had any experience in any psychology class before told me they struggled. Her lectures are long & can get boring.

Go to lecture and take detailed notes on her examples and videos because the exams are mostly based on her lectures. Because it is an honors course, there are 3 easy writing assignments as well as a large research paper. However, she gives a lot of feedback and is available and willing to answer questions.

Dr. Coffey is an amazing professor and I would highly recommend this class if you are even remotely interested in psychology. This is by far one of the most fascinating classes I've taken in college so far, and I enjoyed attending every lecture. Tests aren't easy, but certainly fair. I got a B on most tests. Take this class, you won't regret it.
I took this for the honors section. I really enjoyed this class, and Coffey is such a great lecturer! She provides a lot of real world examples and is very enthusiastic about all of the topics.

Good class but the tests are kinda tough if you aren't the best at memorization. she SPEEDS though lecturespowerpoint. It helps to print off the powerpoint before class with the lines next to each slide to write down anything extra she says but she's mainly reading word for word off the slides. 4 tests in clouding the final. TAKE THE EXTA CREDIT!!

Honors class for Intro Psych. Hardest part is the memorization of terms and functions. Her exams tend to test trivial details from her slides rather than the big concepts, which is frustrating. However she gives very good feedback for the research paper. Intro Psych profs are a mixed bag in general, and Coffey is decent.

Professor Coffey was a very clear lecturer, and really made an effort to keep lectures interesting. The curve is very hard; luckily you can bump your grade up one letter grade if you do all of the extra credit. Not a bad class.

Her powerpoints are all over the place and she often will skip over terms or add things not in the student version of the powerpoint. Pay attention to specific examples, as they are often tested on. Do the extra credit and make notecards off the powerpoint. No learning, here just mindless regurgetating of worthless info. poor professor overall.

Professor Coffey is very kind. When preparing for the tests use the online testsquizzes some questions are pulled directly from there, I definitely recommend PLA. You must go to class. The best way to take note is in the comments sections of her actual powerpoints. Write prompts to remember the videos and examples. Dropping a test - huge plus!

I took Criminal Psych. This class was a mix of really interesting and eye-opening as well as dull and technical. If you are fascinated by assessments, classifications, and criminal processes related to psychopathy and other  disorders, then you will love this class. But beware that there is a lot of technical content that is a little bit dry

Professor Coffey was one of the best professors I've had. If you have an interest in psychology, this class will be very interesting for you. However, this is also one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. I was a 4.0 student in high school and I barely managed to get a C. Know the info, and when u think you're done studying, study some more

Patti knows her stuff and is always willing to meet and help out with students. No busywork- only 4 very difficult exams (one of which is dropped). I mean it when I say you need to know the material like the back of your hand. Really great professor, though! If you don't need to take the class though, I'd pass on it. Pretty difficult.

Knowledgable and relatively interesting to listen too. Gives pretty clear insight into what's going to be on the four tests (you can also drop your worst one) but they make you think- you have to understand the material and be able to apply it to situations. I'd take Professor Coffey's classes any day- made me change my major!

Do the extra credit.  The psych curve is terrible.  Tests are your only grade. I would recommend taking Psych 201 because there is a discussion. Tests are hard, go to lecture, read the book, understand situations, not just definitions.

Professor Coffey is honestly one of the best professors I've had. Definitely take her for psych! The lectures can be kind of boring but she tries to make it more interesting with videos. You definitely need to study a lot for her exams but she even offers extra credit!

The class was not super easy, you really need to study to do well on exams. Best Psych 202 Professor. Lectures aren't bad, she has a lot of experience and shows a lot of videos that helps you to understand the concepts.
Although getting an A is challenging due to the psych department curve, Professor Coffey is an excellent teacher whose lectures are very clear

It is a weed out class but she teaches it best. She understates the importance of text books on the tests, just be sure to skim it. DO ALL THE EXTRA CREDIT. She has some pretty cool stories and is way more interesting than other profs of this class. She also drops a test and doesn't assign anything ever so just study for exams. She is pretty cool.

This class is NOT easy. You have to put in the work to read the book, attend lecture, and study meticulously, but an A is very doable. That being said, the material is interesting and you can tell she loves teaching it. Also she is very helpful with questions. Get a good study buddy and discuss/quiz each other to study weekly. And join a PLA group.

Her exams made you apply what you learned in lecture, not just memorize and regurgitate. Her lectures were clear but sometimes overwhelming with the amount of bullet points on the slides. Overall, she was an interesting lecturer and I learned a lot of cool stuff in psych 202.
She knew what she was talking about but the power lectures got boring and difficult to stay awake during. To do well in this class you really just have to be able to memorize the power points.

Class was interesting, however the fact that it was a power lecture kinda ruined it. I would not say she is a great professor but she is the best out of the psych 202 professors and SHE LETS YOU DROP A TEST GRADE.
Very clear lecturer, helpful professor, and overall nice person. I'd recommend taking this class with her any day.

She is the best teacher for the class but that isn't saying much. The curve is ridiculously unfair and her power points are very poorly organized which makes studying for tests hard. She teaches you the material but she doesn't teach you how to think in the way that is necessary for the exams. Take 202 in high school or at an easier UW over summer

She is a very dry lecturer. Doesn't engage the class and makes power lectures hard to sit through. The exams all have a scientific aspect to them more than the actual psychology. You get to drop your lowest test but it doesn't help much. I would recommend another teacher.

Such a great teacher. She speaks really clearly and is engaging. She's funny and tells really great stories. Pay attention in class and take notes on the videos shown and on the examples she uses because you will be tested on that. The tests aren't too bad if you study and go to class.

This class was challenging, but that's why it is an Honors Level. Patti rushes through the slides, which is what 55 out of 60 of the questions on the exams is. You do four exams, she drops the lowest score, and four mini essays, which are super easy. There is also a research essay, which isn't to hard either. If you take here, study study study!

Coffey was one of my favorite professors ever. Her lectures are very well organized and easy to follow. She does a great job integrating examples  which I found quite helpful in understanding the larger concepts. The textbook was an easy read, especially since she only asks a few questions from it per exam. The exams were extremely fair.

Professor Coffey is a pretty good professor, but sometimes her lectures get boring. She shows a lot of videos in class though, which really helps to relate the content to the real world. She also drops your lowest test score from your first three tests. Tests are pretty tricky and can be difficult. Study study study!

the class was difficult but i love the teacher! she kept it interesting and was very clear when he explained things. she is super helpful and if you listen to her and read the textbook you should be able to pull off a BC and then get the extra credit.

Patti is a great teacher in a challenging course. The curve in the class makes it nearly impossible to get an A (an AB is quite a task too), but she does a good job making the class as good as it can be. Be sure to read the textbook thoroughly and regularly, and also make sure to review power points.
